content.question: The rotational inertia of a slim rod of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> about a perpendicular axis through its center of mass is <math alttext="the fraction m L squared, over 12" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>/</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the rotational inertia of the rod about a perpendicular axis through a point on the rod at a distance of <math alttext="the fraction L over 3 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> from the center of mass of the rod?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over 36, end fraction, times m L squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 7 over 36, end fraction, times m L squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one fourth times m L squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="five twelfths times m L squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="three fourths times m L squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 7 over 36, end fraction, times m L squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
